poem:
"Of Modern Heroes and Antiquated Lands"

Cinematic mayhem shrouds the humble toil,
In Italy's embrace, a linen-suited foil.
On screen, Jones' shadow in every crevice lurks;
A kingdom of apes, where antiquity smirks.
Splendidly rumpled, in treasures he doth drown,
While the crown gazes with a silent frown.
All the world's an artefact, and we but dreamers lost,
In this luminescent chaos, at what terrible cost?
